snippet: Two wide-ranging compilations by contemporary masters of commercial graphic design, and an exploration of the visual possibilities offered by typographical tools.
abstract: Gerry Beegan reviews design books How To: Use Graphic Design to Sell Things, Explain Things, Make Things Look Better, Make People Laugh, Make People Cry, and (Every Once in a While) Change the World by Michael Bierut, Variations on a Rectangle: 30 Years of Graphic Design, From Texas Monthly to Pentagram by D J Stout and The Art of Typewriting by Marvin and Ruth Sackner.
lead_paragraph: Two wide-ranging compilations by contemporary masters of commercial graphic design, and an exploration of the visual possibilities offered by typographical tools.

headline.main: ‘How To,’ ‘Variations on a Rectangle’ and ‘The Art of Typewriting’
